verbs.description: outlance (third-person singular simple present outlances, present participle outlancing, simple past and past participle outlanced)

examples: Before Dane had his glasses in focus, the outlancing strike of light was cut off, knife sharp.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To surpass in fighting or jousting with a lance.
examples: I want some prince to challenge a knight who's a cad / And outlance the lad / To show me he's my hero.
